conclusion: The v-t graph shows the velocity of the skydiver at different times. The area under the graph represents the distance fallen.
At 0 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s. At 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s.
To estimate the area under the curve, approximate the curve as a triangle with base 10 seconds and height 20 m/s.
Area of a triangle = (1/2) * base * height.
Calculate the area: (1/2) * 10 seconds * 20 m/s = 100 square meters.
The area under the curve (which represents the distance fallen) is exactly 100 meters.
